main event: On July 7, 1951, in Newport News, Virginia, two military informants sighted an unidentified spherical lighted object in the northwestern portion of the sky at approximately a 45 to 50 degree angle. The object appeared to suddenly black out and plunge earthward before disappearing towards the northwestern horizon.
interesting points: The report was an 'Unconventional Aircraft' observation marked as 'UNCLASSIFIED' and forwarded for necessary action.
The object was described as having a gaseous glow, spherical shape, and appeared stationary until disappearance, which was attributed to probable disappearance in cloud conditions.
The informants, two soldiers, were considered truthful, reliable, and intelligent as per a local check, and no motive could be discovered for reporting the incident.
The document is part of Project Blue Book, a U.S. Air Force program that investigated unidentified flying objects between 1947 and 1969.
The report was submitted to the Commanding General of the Headquarters First Air Force at Mitchell Air Force Base in New York.
